definition: formation of a loanword using a combination of characters or words that suggests its meaning (as opposed to transliteration 音譯|音译[yin1 yi4]) (e.g. 超文本[chao1 wen2 ben3], 火車|火车[huo3 che1])
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
meaning (of foreign expression)/translation of the meaning (as opposed to literal translation 直譯|直译)/paraphrase/free translation

transliteration (rendering phonetic value, e.g. of English words in Chinese characters)/characters giving phonetic value of Chinese word or name (when the correct characters may be unknown)/transcription (linguistics)/to transcribe phonetic symbols
see 唯識宗|唯识宗[Wei2 shi2 zong1]
Gautama, surname of the Siddhartha, the historical Buddha
arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
Pali, language of Theravad Pali canon
see 唯識宗|唯识宗[Wei2 shi2 zong1]
